definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out

sentences.english: The nation has built first-world infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 中国建成的公共设施已经处于世界第一。

sentences.english: Poor maintenance of public facilities can have disastrous health implications.
sentences.chinese: 公共设施失修可造成卫生灾难。

sentences.english: Part V of the non-operating public facilities management liability study.
sentences.chinese: 第五部分是对非经营性公共设施管理法律责任的研究。

sentences.english: We will arrange for those that have returned to their home villages to take part in the construction of local public facilities.
sentences.chinese: 组织返乡农民工参与农村公共设施建设。

sentences.english: The government has just repealed the law segregating the public facilities.
sentences.chinese: 这个政府已经撤销了分离公共设施的法律。

sentences.english: Different tax arragements apply to public utilities.
sentences.chinese: 有适合于公共设施的不同的岁收制度。

sentences.english: Cherish communal establishment, not to mangle public property.
sentences.chinese: 爱护公共设施，不损坏公物。

sentences.english: The town has benefited from new parks and other public facilities such as an artificial lake.
sentences.chinese: 城市受益于新的公园和其他公共设施，如一个人工湖。

sentences.english: Matters concerning construction and administration of public facilities.
sentences.chinese: 二二关于各项公共设施之建设及管理事项。

sentences.english: “This is definitely a public facility,” Mr. Liu said.
sentences.chinese: “广州歌剧院绝对是个公共设施，”刘先生说道。

sentences.english: Part five probes into the system of investigation and evidence collection.
sentences.chinese: 第五部分探讨了公共设施公益诉讼的调查取证制度。

definition: to make green with plants/to reforest/(Internet slang) Islamization
public utility/state-run enterprise/public foundation or enterprise, often charitable
environmental sanitation/abbr. to 環衛|环卫[huan2 wei4]
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
